did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: A diverse collection of materials from various sources about Cockenoe Island, the largest of the Norwalk Islands. Cockenoe lies one mile off Westport.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Westport Historical Society.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], [Box no]., Westport Historical Society

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: The earliest historical mention of Cockenoe was a 17th century reference to "Cochenoe's Island; so named after an indian, Cochenoe. In the 1960s, the island was owned by the United Illuminating Company. When UI announced plans to use the island as a base for a nuclear power plant, Westport citizens began a two year campaign to defeat the plan. The plan was defeated and the town of Westport bought the island. Thirty years later, September 12-13, 1997, Westport held an anniversary celebration of the Cockenoe Island victory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection includes photos, news articles, victory celebration plans and publicity, and an environmental protection plan.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The arrangement of the collection includes the history(news articles and photos), followed by the plans for the preservation of the island(protection plan), and ending with the victory celebration(news articles,photos, plans, publicity and entertainment script).
